name: Project 4th Wall Break
description:
**PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS IS A PROTOTYPE FOR AN IDEA THAT MAY COME TO PASS IF GIVEN ENOUGH SUPPORT**

The game environment is inspired by the ancient educational “mecca” of Timbuktu where seekers of knowledge far and wide would travel to, in order enrich their knowledge and broaden their horizons.

Our game takes place in a museum space where our players may be free to explore and discover new knowledge by interesting artifacts and engage in quizzes that test one’s knowledge of all things African.

The aim for later builds is to have the museum area expand into further spaces each customized and stylized to fit the themes of the topic chosen (e.g. A hanger of automation will have vehicles which the users may interact with and also learn some general and “fun fact knowledge” about a particular automobile manufacturer and its heritage.)

We believe the game should mainly be a VR(virtual reality) title with a 3rd Person option for those without the hardware necessary for VR. Utilizing VR would provide the ultimate player experience and create the level of awe and wonder we seek to instill in our players/users.

The game may also serve as a host for a “Metaverse” in which we will facilitate the displaying, viewing and advertisement of NFT projects, with custom spaces provided and the ability for artist to share their work to be showcased in our various virtual Art Galleries.

The ultimate aim for this game is to achieve all fore mentioned aspects in a visually enthralling manner with support for multiplayer group experiences much like a group tour in real world.

This prototype was created during a 48 hour Game Jam hosted by Animation SA and sponsored by Adanian Labs.

Developed by: Vedanth Panchoo, Jayaveer Harilal, Nkanyezi Thabethe, Thapelo Moima and Fuzo Magudulela.

Music: Song for Denise (Maxi Version) - we do not own the song, just thought it would be fun track to use.
